Package de.mslab.errors

Provides error classes which communicate errors occurring in all further packages of this framework in understandable and precise fashion.

See: Description

  • Error Summary 
    Error Description
    InvalidArgumentError
    Indicates that a parameter for the maximum hamming weight was invalid, for instance if the maximum hamming weight limit of a value is higher than the number of bits in the value.
    InvalidKeySizeError
    Thrown if a cipher is given a secret key with an invalid size.
    InvalidStateSizeError
    Thrown if a cipher is given a message block with another size than the state size of that cipher.
    InvalidTweakSizeError
    Thrown if a cipher is given a secret Tweak with an invalid size.
    NoKeyRequiredError
    Thrown if a cipher which does not require a key is given a key.
    NoKeySpecifiedError
    Thrown by the encrypt or decrypt methods of block ciphers, in case the cipher has not been initialized with a secret key before.
    NoSuchCipherError
    Thrown in case there is no cipher in the CipherFactory.CipherName enumeration with the proposed name.
    NoTweakSpecifiedError
    Thrown by instances of type TweakableCipher, in case the encrypt or decrypt methods were invoked before the cipher was given a tweak.

Package de.mslab.errors Description

Provides error classes which communicate errors occurring in all further packages of this framework in understandable and precise fashion.
